title: Drawing, "Alligator, Monstrous Tree, Colombia", 1853
inscribed:
Inscribed in graphite, at upper right: Monstrous / tree; at center of upper left: Alligator; again: like; at center right: Light feathery foliage in masses/very scattered but englobing the /whole tree.  These scattered/masses allow the ramification/ of the branches to be seen distinctly/ [In the heart - struck out] at the joining; at right: Chocolate and cream/color'd bark mixed; again at lower left: Palma Guiniensis/Tagua Palm/oil palm/This part/of the /trunk more/grey; and at lower right:
Masses de-/termined distinctly/ [sharply - struck out] by a rich edging of/yellowish green
description: Horizontal view containing tree trops on top row; a swimming alligator at center left; a palm top at lower left; a tree at lower center; and botanical details at lower right.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Alligator, Monstrous Tree, Colombia", 1853. Graphite on gray wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-132.
